RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 29, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RAP ARTIST was the speed of the race and took advantage it, took the lead early, secured the rail spot, set the pace to his liking, and drew off late uncontested, was much the best today. CARLOS PUNCH vied for the early lead then eased back just a bit and stalked the eventual leader from the three path, stayed just at the leaders hip until he was asked at the half mile pole, moved up half of a length on the outside, another rival moved up beside him along the rail, had room but could not get a head of the eventual winner and chased through the lane earning second place dividends. SILKY'S DANCE settled off of the pace, mid pack on the rail, was asked to advance at the half mile pole, responded with a mild bid and held his position. HEREWECOMETOGETYOU was off a half of a step slow, settled well off the pace in the three path, was encouraged at the half mile pole and showed a brief turn of foot as he was able to circle half of his competitors through the turn, raced five wide down the stretch but to no avail. PAYNTED LOVER made no impact. ROCK STAR ALEX was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Rap Artist
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, set pace, rail trip, much the best

ENTRY.NAME: Carlos Punch
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated, stalked, 3w, chased, held on for second

ENTRY.NAME: Herewecometogetyou
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow start, settled off pace, 3w, 4w stretch, no avail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 7 1/2F Turf CR: 55. Claiming Purse 18000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHE'S TAKIN OVER was off a step slow, raced four wide through the first turn and down the back stretch, launched a bid at the half mile pole, moved in between foes, found room and angled out five wide entering the stretch, was encouraged and kept on point, responded willingly and cleared the early leader after the sixteenth pole. TRACK QUEEN raced five wide while tugging against her reins through the first quarter, settled along the outside in the second tier and stalked the early leader, launched her bid after the half mile pole on the outside and responded well, drew clear at the quarter pole, was driven, and encouraged but was run down late by a closing foe and settled for second place honors today. Still very game effort today. SUE'S LITTLE ZING bumped at the start, was quickly corrected and vied for the lead, took the rail and set the pace as he showed the way, was challenged at the three eights pole, gamely battled on through the stretch but gave way late. GEAUX VOTE broke and settled off the pace, raced along the rail, was behind the leader and had a set of competitors on her outside, patiently waited for racing room, angled out into the four path at the quarter pole, but had no late kick. MOR KISSES bumped at the start, settled off the leader in the three path and stalked, was joined by another competitor at the half mile pole, traveled in company with that foe while stalking the leader until the three eighths pole then faded. COUSIN VICKIE showed little. ZEEROCK was never involved. T J'S FIRST trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: T J's First
ENTRY.OWNER: Roe Steve D and Roe Patricia L

ENTRY.NAME: Geaux Vote
ENTRY.OWNER: The Peach Pit LLC and Abbott Barbara

ENTRY.NAME: Sue's Little Zing
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd, speed, pace, rail, gave way late,

ENTRY.NAME: She's Takin Over
ENTRY.COMMENT: offslw, 4w, off pace, advanced 1/2 btwn, angled 5w stretch, up

ENTRY.NAME: Track Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w, strong, 2nd tier 1/2, cued 3/8, led, caught late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 13250. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MINT was fractious in the gates, momentarily stalked from the four path, willingly improved position, challenged the early leaders for a few strides on the outside after the half mile pole, assumed command before the quarter pole, drew away for another easy win. HAIL SOUTHERN vied for the early and and raced along the while setting the early fractions, was challenged by two outside rivals at the half mile pole, relinquished the lead, shifted out at the quarter pole and raced four wide down the lane, struggled to switch leads and had to settle for second place today. CRAFTY HEAT stalked from the two path, was joined by another competitor and raced with company, challenged the early leader at the three eights pole, couldn't sustain the bid with the horse to his out side and gave way. J'S LITTLE MAN showed little. SOUTH AL SPARKY was never involved. CLERIC raced off the pace along the rail and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Hail Southern
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, collard1/2, shifted out 1/4. left lead, closed,2ndbest

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE NOVEMBER 29, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 29, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PROUD VICTORIA vied for the early lead, raced on the rail while smartly taking back and stalking the three early leaders, waited until the five sixteenth pole to launch a bid, shifted out a bit, had clean racing room, and was asked, responded willingly and quickly, was kept on point and was up in time to gamely take the top spot. KEWPIE DOLL stalked the early pace from the three path, launched a bid at the five sixteenth pole, took the lead in the furlong ground but was caught just a few strides later and settled for second. HURRICANE TIZWAY vied for the early lead and was able to secure the rail, raced along the rail, was pressured by outside contenders, repelled these rivals while passing the quarter pole, but was quickly challenged in deep stretch and gave way late. POINT OF VICTORY settled off the pace, angled down to the rail, saved ground but to no avail. QUEEN'S MISSION showed little. L G GIRL was never involved. KIND WAYS was no menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Proud Victoria
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, smartly settled, rail, shifted out 5-16th, 5wuppr, upintime

ENTRY.NAME: Hurricane Tizway
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent, rail, led, pressured, drew clear upper, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Kewpie Doll
ENTRY.OWNER: Beshears, Kathy and Beshears, Eddy A.
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, bid 5-16th, led in btwn calls, was caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Point of Victory
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, off pace, angled to rail, but to no avail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 5F Turf CR: 82. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 31000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances). (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlo ngs) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IRONIT raced along the rail a few lengths off the early speed on a loose rein, gently edged out into the four path at the five sixteenth marker, circled the field through the rest of the turn willingly, was four wide entering the stretch, was encouraged with the right handed crop at the top of the lane, responded well, was slightly encourage into deep stretch and drew away under a hand ride. HARRIET'S DREAM vied for the early lead, raced in the two path while setting a brisk pace, was pushed by an inside challenger, and pressured by a rival on the outside, shook those contenders, to be caught in the stretch by a fast closing challenger, battled briefly and tired. SCAMPERING GRAYCE raced off the pace five wide, followed the eventual winner's path through traffic, closed well but it was not enough today. HUSHED COURT ROOM raced off of the pace three wide, maintained that position, was asked, closed mildly and passed tired foes. OURPERFECTPRINCESS vied for the early lead along the rail, drew next to the leader then gave way. TWN MS MIDSHIP raced in the two path but could never get involved. MISS PRIORITY raced on the rail, had no excuse. LA SMOOCHIE raced in the four path, was briefly in contention after the half mile pole, faltered. THE MISSING PIECE off slow, trailed.

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: David N. Meche & Perry J. Judice

ENTRY.NAME: Hushed Court Room
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, off pace, closed, passed tired foes

ENTRY.NAME: The Missing Piece
ENTRY.OWNER: Harden Patricia M and Hargrave Randall

ENTRY.NAME: Harriet's Dream
ENTRY.OWNER: World War IV Racing and Rebel Tide Racing, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Scampering Grayce
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 5w, followed winner's path, not enough

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 16750. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE DECEMBER 29, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 29, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ZION was in complete control, uncontested and wire to wire win. WISE GUY was off slow, raced in the four path early, was cued and made one run advancing along the outside, circled the field through the turn, raced four wide down the stretch, chased the leader but was definetly second best. MIND ON MY MONEY was off a step slow, advanced position in between foes, was forwardly placed moving into the turn, gently took back, edged out into the five path in the upper stretch, was asked and closed well getting up for third. ZONG TOUGH was six wide and settled off the pace, launched a mild bid at the half mile pole, but to no avail. PERFECT PERIGEE stalked the early pace from the four path, moved in between horses and advanced into the second flight on the outside, was in contention and faltered. CYPRIANO rail, no factor. J B GRAY vied for the lead, settled along the fence, chased the leader then faded. SIR OVERANALYZE raced six wide, was no menace. GRIEF trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Mind On My Money
ENTRY.COMMENT: offslw ,advanced in btwn, took back, edged out, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Wise Guy
ENTRY.COMMENT: slwstrt, off pace, 6w, advanced 1/2,circled turn, chased, 2ndbest

ENTRY.NAME: Zong Tough
ENTRY.OWNER: Castillo Rafael Miguel and Foster Joseph M
ENTRY.COMMENT: 6w, off pace, settled, bid 1/2, mild effort

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 68. Allowance Purse 28000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HAMAZING DEBATE raced from off the pace from the four path, was given the cue at the half mile pole, made one run while being slight encouraged and kept on point, had gained momentum racing down the stretch was able to edge past her rivals and get up in time for the win. GOLD STRATEGY was off slow, stayed on the rail while improving position, angled out at the quarter pole and continued to gain ground, shifted out again and kept closing was able to get up for second place. MY LADY LUNA raced along the rail, was forwardly placed and under pressure through out, tired late, still a game effort. MUSIC MISTRESS was forwardly placed, but faltered late. VOODOO MISTRESS was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Strategy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, rail, edged out 1/4, angled out 6 wide, strtch, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Hamazing Debate
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 4w, driven, kept on point, closed, up for the win

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 8 1M Turf CR: 92. Claiming Purse 17000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since April 29, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MORE ICE stalked the pace setters from the three path, was cued at the half mile pole, was encouraged and kept on point, was able to out finish the rest. NATE'S ATTACK raced from off the pace on the inside early, advanced up in between foes along the backside, gained ground and moved into a stalking position along the rail, coolly stayed on the fence and took advantage of the rail opening up at the quarter pole, closed well and just missed. AFLEET ASCENT vied for the lead, attended the pace, then tired late. OAK HILL SOLUTION stalked the pace, was in contention then faltered. SENATOR CON raced along the rail in mid pack, maintained that position through out. ITS A CITY DAY showed little. HARD LOVE was never involved. DOC IRWIN gave a mild effort before fading. VINYL trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Nate's Attack
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pce, inside trip, up in btwn, advanced rail, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: More Ice
ENTRY.OWNER: Tri-Star Racing LLC and Foster Cheryl
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, gained ground closed, out finished the rest

ENTRY.NAME: Its a City Day
ENTRY.OWNER: Jarrett Jr Terrell and Lara Racing Stables LLC
